@description.name: @description
@description.body: Generic selection manager to bring rich desktop like selection behavior to widgets and low-level interactive controls. The selection handling supports both Shift and Ctrl/Meta modifies like known from native applications.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fires after the selection was modified. Contains the selection under the data property.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Selects the selection mode to use.

  • single: One or no element is selected
  • multi: Multi items could be selected. Also allows empty selections.
  • additive: Easy Web-2.0 selection mode. Allows multiple selections without modifier keys.
  • one: If possible always exactly one item is selected

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Enable drag selection (multi selection of items through dragging the pointer in pressed states). Only possible for the modes multi and additive

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Enable quick selection mode, where no tap is needed to change the selection. Only possible for the modes single and one.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the selection can be changed by user interaction

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The owning object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: {String} The ID of the object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the selection context. One of tap, quick, drag or key or null.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Selects all items of the managed object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Selects the given item. Replaces current selection completely with the new item. Use {@link #addItem} instead if you want to add new items to an existing selection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds the given item to the existing selection. Use {@link #selectItem} instead if you want to replace the current selection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes the given item from the selection. Use {@link #clearSelection} when you want to clear the whole selection at once.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Selects an item range between two given items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Clears the whole selection at once. Also resets the lead and anchor items and their styles.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Replaces current selection with given array of items. Please note that in single selection scenarios it is more efficient to directly use {@link #selectItem}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the selected item. This method does only work in single selection mode.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array of currently selected items. Note: The result is only a set of selected items, so the order can differ from the sequence in which the items were added.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the selection sorted by the index in the container of the selection (the assigned widget)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Detects whether the given item is currently selected.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the selection is empty

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Invert the selection. Select the non selected and deselect the selected.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the lead item. Generally the item which was last modified by the user (tapped on etc.)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the current lead item. Generally the item which was last modified by the user (tapped on etc.)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the anchor item. This is the item which is the starting point for all range selections. Normally this is the item which was tapped on the last time without any modifier keys pressed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the current anchor item. This is the item which is the starting point for all range selections. Normally this is the item which was tapped on the last time without any modifier keys pressed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the given item is selectable.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Finds the selectable instance from a pointer event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an unique hashcode for the given item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Updates the style (appearance) of the given item.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: enabled {Boolean} Whether the given style should be added or removed.
@param.description: Whether the given style should be added or removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Enables capturing of the container.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Releases capturing of the container

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the location of the container

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the dimension of the container (available scrolling space).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the relative (to the container) horizontal location of the given item.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map with the keys left and right.
@return.description: A map with the keys left and right.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the relative (to the container) horizontal location of the given item.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map with the keys top and bottom.
@return.description: A map with the keys top and bottom.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the scroll position of the container.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Scrolls by the given offset

@param.name: @param
@param.body: xoff {Integer} Horizontal offset to scroll by

@param.name: @param
@param.body: yoff {Integer} Vertical offset to scroll by

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Scrolls the given item into the view (make it visible)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns all selectable items of the container.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
all {Boolean} true for all selectables, false for the
   selectables the user can interactively select
@param.description:
true for all selectables, false for the
   selectables the user can interactively select

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns all selectable items between the two given items. The items could be given in any order.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the first selectable item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the last selectable item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the first visible and selectable item.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The first visible and selectable item
@return.description: The first visible and selectable item

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the last visible and selectable item.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The last visible and selectable item
@return.description: The last visible and selectable item

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a selectable item which is related to the given item through the value of relation.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the item which should be selected on pageUp/pageDown. May also scroll to the needed position.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: up {Boolean?false} Which page key was pressed: up or down.
@param.description: Which page key was pressed: up or down.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method should be connected to the pointerover event of the managed object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method should be connected to the pointerdown event of the managed object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method should be connected to the tap event of the managed object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method should be connected to the losecapture event of the managed object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method should be connected to the pointermove event of the managed object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method should be connected to the addItem event of the managed object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method should be connected to the removeItem event of the managed object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Stops all timers, release capture etc. to cleanup drag selection

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event listener for timer used by drag selection

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Automatically selects items based on the pointer movement during a drag selection

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method should be connected to the keypress event of the managed object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: event {qx.event.type.KeySequence} A valid key sequence event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds all items to the selection

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Clears current selection

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Select a range from item1 to item2.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
extend {Boolean?false} Whether the current
    selection should be replaced or extended.
@param.description:
Whether the current
    selection should be replaced or extended.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Deselect all items between item1 and item2.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal method to convert a range to a map of hash codes for faster lookup during selection compare routines.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the first selected item. Only makes sense when using manager in single selection mode.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Replace current selection with given item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds an item to the current selection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Toggles the item e.g. remove it when already selected or select it when currently not.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes the given item from the current selection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Replaces current selection with items from given array.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: items {Array} List of items to select

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fires the selection change event if the selection has been modified.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Applies the default selection. The default item is the first item.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: force {Boolean} Whether the default selection should be forced.
@param.description: Whether the default selection should be forced.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxObjectId. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property mode. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #mode}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property mode. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #mode}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property mode. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #mode}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property drag. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #drag}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property drag. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #drag}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property drag. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #drag}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property drag. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #drag}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property quick. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #quick}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property quick. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #quick}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property quick. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #quick}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property quick. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #quick}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property readOnly. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #readOnly}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property readOnly. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #readOnly}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property readOnly. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #readOnly}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property readOnly. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #readOnly}.
